name: RAMification (Sqrt2)
description:
RAMification

_________________________________________________

Description

A small virus is trying to traverse the memory of it's home computer, pushing aside unnecessary files, always on the search for the next key. Put your puzzle-solving abilties to use and try to help him! 46 tricky levels are waiting for you.

Good luck and have fun!

_________________________________________________

Controls

During the journey you will be able to use the help of different virus types.

Use WASD to MOVE your active virus.

Hold Space to spawn a ghostlike clone of your virus, which can move around a little and spawn the other virus types (using the number keys 2-4), once they are collected.

Use the number keys 1-4 (normal keyboard, not the Numpad) to activate / switch between your normal virus and the other virus types.

Each of the three virus types has different abilities, which you will discover over time, and a specific number of steps it can make before it deletes itself.

With the back button you restart the current level.

If u puzzle is to difficult for you, you can skip it with T and retry it at a later point. However you can only have 3 skipped levels at any time.

_________________________________________________

Tips

  • Use WASD, Enter and Escape to control the menu.
  • Quit the game via the Main Menu. This way your progress does get saved!

_________________________________________________

Features

  • 46 tricky levels
  • 4 playable virus types with different abilities
  • You handle porn folders!

_________________________________________________

Note: Does exclusively  run on Windows!

Please leave us some feedback!

_________________________________________________

Known Issues / Bugs:

  • You may need to run the game with admin priveleges to make sure files can be loaded and saved correctly (especially if it crashes during profile creation)

If you have encounter any technical issues or find unknown bugs, please let us know and we will try our best to solve them.

When reporting an issue, please send us the OS-Version you're on (e.g. Windows 10 32-Bit) and if possible try to describe how we can reproduce the error.
